meanings.definition: Having the most grip or traction.
meanings.sent1: The new shoes I bought are the grippiest ones I've ever owned.
meanings.sent2: The rock climber chose the grippiest gloves for the challenging ascent.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the carpet was the grippiest thing in the house, so it always sharpened its claws there.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the grippiest force that kept her going through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The grippiest handle on the suitcase made it easy to carry even when fully packed.

meanings.definition: Capable of providing the strongest hold or grasp.
meanings.sent1: The grippiest tape held the poster securely on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used the grippiest wrench to tighten the bolt.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's grip on the toy was so grippiest that no one could take it away without a struggle.
meanings.sent4: His words had the grippiest impact on her decision to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The grippiest handshake he ever received left a lasting impression on him.
